channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Deep pot holes on pavement, 6th October
item.description:
There are deep potholes on the pavement outside between 11 and 15 yew tree close it is hard to get round with pushchair. could someone please come and fill in the potholes to make my life easier thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Yew Tree Close, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpath overgrown - impassable, 6th October
item.description:
Entire length of footpath on north side of Horsebere brook is impassable due to overgrown trees, brambles, plants etc Footpath roughly follows north side of Horsebere Brook from where the brook goes under the east side of the M5 until the bridge for the B4641.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Perrybrook Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No HGV sign missing, 6th October
item.description:
At the entrance to Chandos Street the No HGV sign is missing. Incident Summary (5th September 2025): • A large COOP HGV attempted to access the COOP store on Greet Road via Chandos Street, which is signposted as unsuitable for HGVs. • The truck was seen reversing from the North Street junction back along Chandos Street toward Broadway Road, causing disruption. • The driver refused initial assistance from the reporting resident and claimed no visible signage indicated the road was unsuitable for HGVs. • The driver eventually accepted help to reverse onto Broadway Road, but did not follow the suggested safer route to the COOP, instead likely taking a more dangerous path via Hailes Street and North Street. Issues Identified: • Inadequate or poorly positioned signage: • Existing “Unsuitable for HGVs” signs are either missing, obscured, or facing the wrong direction. • No signage on Hailes Street, which is a common approach route for HGVs. Recommendations: 1. Replace existing signs at locations A (Broadway Road), B (Chandos Street), and C (North Street) with clearer, more visible signs, especially for non-English-speaking drivers. 2. Reorient signs at locations B and C to face oncoming traffic more effectively. 3. Install a new sign on Hailes Street, facing traffic approaching the North Street junction, to prevent similar incidents. Supporting Materials: • Street maps showing the truck’s route and attempted maneuvers. • Photographs and Google Street View images illustrating the road layout and current signage.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chandos Street, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Racist Graffiti on a public highway, 5th October
item.description:
I am emailing because there is racist graffiti in the form of a red George Cross spray-painted on the mini-roundabout at the junction of Green Lane and Drews Court in Churchdown. It has been there for a number of weeks and was still there today, 5th October. I can see from your website that this was also reported on 20th September. This is hate-related vandalism intended to show immigrants from other countries and in particular those of colour that they are not welcome in the UK. It also affects the road markings on a public highway. Please can you arrange for this be removed/repainted as a matter of urgency for safety and because it is offensive to the local community? Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
